document_data.name: House of the Path and the Way
document_data.mainbody: The '''House of the Path and the Way''' was a shrine to the combined faith of [[the Path and the Way]] and the [[Celestial Bureaucracy]] found in the city of [[Bral]] on the [[Rock of Bral]] in the mid-to-late 14{{th}} century [[DR]].<ref>
document_data.Location: It stood in the [[Middle City]] of Bral, within the Temple District. It lay between Mainmast Street and Temple Street, and faced onto Temple Square.<ref>
document_data.Activities: A small and humble place, the House saw little in the way of organized worship, but self-contemplation and the pursuit of enlightenment. Priests of any [[deity]] were welcomed, but followers of the Path and the Way were likely to explain where their deity served in the Celestial Bureaucracy and correct their views of the multiverse.
document_data.Inhabitants: Fewer than half a dozen priests and priestesses tended to the shrine. They passed their time in studies and meditation, and did not proselytize or otherwise seek converts.
